label: Content Experience Director
title: Content Experience Director
description: Owns end-to-end content strategy, headless CMS operations, AI-powered content generation, and multi-channel content delivery responsible for engagement, SEO, and brand consistency.
responsibilities: Define and execute content strategy across all channels
Manage headless CMS platform and content operations
Lead AI-powered content generation and personalization programs
Oversee content performance analytics and optimization
Ensure brand voice consistency across all content
Manage digital asset management (DAM) and content governance
traditionalWorkflow: Manual content creation taking 4-8 hours per piece
Generic content same for all website visitors
Weekly content updates requiring full site deployments
Spreadsheet-based content calendar and workflows
Manual DAM organization with 15-30 min asset search times
agenticWorkflow: AI content generation producing drafts in 30-60 minutes
1:1 personalized content delivered in <100ms via CDN
Real-time content updates without deployments
Automated content workflow with AI-powered approvals
AI auto-tagging enabling 2-5 min asset retrieval

One-size-fits-all content yields only 15-25% engagement
Deployment bottlenecks delay timely content (2-5 days)
Email approval workflows take 10-20 days
Asset search waste consumes 30% of creative team time

label: Merchandising Director
title: Merchandising Director / VP of Merchandising
description: Oversees all merchandising operations including assortment planning, pricing strategy, promotional campaigns, and financial planning responsible for category profitability and inventory optimization.
responsibilities: Lead merchandise financial planning (MFP) and OTB management
Define assortment strategy and optimize category mix
Set pricing and markdown strategy across all channels
Plan and execute promotional campaigns
Manage category performance and profitability
Oversee merchandising analytics and insights
traditionalWorkflow: Annual MFP planning cycle taking 6-12 weeks
One-size-fits-all assortment across all stores
Manual pricing updates based on weekly competitive checks
Calendar-driven markdowns ignoring inventory reality
Monthly merchandising reports in spreadsheets
agenticWorkflow: Continuous rolling forecasts with 2-3 week planning cycles
Localized assortments optimized for 100+ store clusters
AI dynamic pricing with real-time competitive intelligence
Demand-driven markdowns maximizing revenue and clearance
Real-time merchandising dashboards with predictive insights
painPointsAddressed: Annual static plans become outdated within weeks
Generic assortments yield sub-optimal local performance
Manual pricing leaves 10-15% margin on table
Calendar markdowns cause 20-40% unnecessary margin erosion
Delayed reporting prevents agile decision-making

Coordinate multi-channel product syndication

traditionalWorkflow: Product data scattered across spreadsheets and systems

Manual product syndication to each channel separately
Quarterly product data quality audits

One-click syndication to 10+ channels simultaneously
Continuous AI-powered data quality monitoring with auto-correction
painPointsAddressed: Siloed product data causes 70-85% accuracy problems
Manual enrichment bottleneck limits new product launches

Manual syndication errors cause channel inconsistencies
Quarterly audits discover issues too late
